page.title: 02LOCAL GOVERNMENT.
page.content: The area contains parts of a number of Parish Councils: Amport, Thruxton, Fyfield, Monxton and Penton Mewsey. The Councils meet once a month to discuss matters of local interest and importance. The type of item that would appear on a normal agenda would include Planning Applications, the upkeep of Public Facilities for which the Council is responsible, such as bus shelters and children's play equipment, the general tidiness of the parish, the maintenance of footpaths, protection of trees, local monuments, listed buildings, etc., and council finances. Councils vary. Amport is one of the largest parishes in the area with an electorate of approximately 900 people and a council of ten. Monxton, with an electorate of 280, has five members.
